newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian base metals market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian base metals market closed for holiday.

text.p: The Bombay metals market was closed on Thursday for a local holiday.
On Wednesday, copper joined zinc and lead prices in their downward movement while other base metals held steady in quiet trade.
Zinc fell 50 rupees at 7,750 rupees per quintal after losing 50 rupees on Tuesday while lead slid 50 rupees at 4,200 rupees per quintal after losing 100 rupees on Tuesday.
Copper moved down 50 rupees at 13,450 rupees while aluminium was indicated at the previous level of 7,450 rupees per quintal amid nominal trading.
Tin was steady at 31,200 rupees as was nickel at 36,100 rupees per quintal.
